messages.messageBody:
What a great interview and so easy to read.

If google translate does a good job I will forward this to my parents.
Thank you both for this interview!

Priscilla, mother of Ayla (2yo) & Ravi (9mo)

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a new interview
messages.msgSnippet: mom in India has been corresponding with me, building the exchange into a conversation for her blog. Sandra, what an exchange it was! I m so grateful to you
messages.messageBody:
"mom in India has been corresponding with me, building the exchange into
a conversation for her blog."

Sandra, what an exchange it was! I'm so grateful to you for your time and
thoughts to those dozen and more questions! I'm looking forward to
continuing this for the second part of the interview :-)

Love,
Rashmie

www.mommy-labs.com

messages.messageBody:
Great interview and what a nice collection of pictures..
Also especially loved the Navaratri bit :)..
This year Veda is 3 and I have already bought a set of mud dolls for her
that she can have all for herself..
Thanks Sandra for the simple but great idea!
Pushpa

messages.subject: a new interview
messages.msgSnippet: I mom in India has been corresponding with me, building the exchange into a conversation for her blog. The building behind my family in that first photo is
messages.messageBody:
I mom in India has been corresponding with me, building the exchange into a conversation for her blog.

The building behind my family in that first photo is *not* my house. :-) We visited Jihong in Texas a while back. But that is my family. Keith, Holly, Kirby, me and Marty. And Jill Parmer took the photo (or one of her kids did, but I think Jill did).


http://www.mommy-labs.com/inspiring-interviews/homeschooling-inspiring-interviews/interview-with-sandra-dodd-unschooling-homeschooling-india/

Sandra
